result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Guentzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Defendant must submit a DNA specimen, as required by law unless it has already been done. Defendant must pay for the costs of testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

timeConds.notes: per week when not employed full time, enrolled in school full time or a combination of both equal to full time.
IMPOSED & STAYED.    AMENDED 05-17-2016:  Lift of stayed conditional time - defendant to serve 90 days with credit from 04-13-2016.

Defendant Thomas J Guentzel in court with attorney Rod J. Koenen.  Defendant Thomas J Guentzel in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Notice of 4/2/14 Hearing to Rod J Koenen - Return to sender - box closed.
Preliminary hearing on April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Thomas J Guentzel in court with attorney Rod J. Koenen.  Defendant Thomas J Guentzel in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
